body_html:
The error says that "input_producer/input_producer/
fraction_of_32_full/limit_epochs/epochs" has not been initialized, which
should be initialized by running "tf.initialize_local_variables()"

Can you check that this variable is present the local variables collection (
[v.name for v in tf.get_collection(tf.GraphKeys.LOCAL_VARIABLES)]) or the
regular collection ([v.name for v in
tf.get_collection(tf.GraphKeys.LOCAL_VARIABLES)])

On Tue, Aug 16, 2016 at 11:40 AM, Kalle Svensson notifications@github.com
wrote:

No, I'm doing that. As I said, I can train the net if I remove the
num_epochs argument to tf.train.slice_input_producer and handle the
epochs "manually" in the train loop.

—

body:
The error says that "input_producer/input_producer/
fraction_of_32_full/limit_epochs/epochs" has not been initialized, which
should be initialized by running "tf.initialize_local_variables()"

Can you check that this variable is present the local variables collection (
[v.name for v in tf.get_collection(tf.GraphKeys.LOCAL_VARIABLES)]) or the
regular collection ([v.name for v in
tf.get_collection(tf.GraphKeys.LOCAL_VARIABLES)])

On Tue, Aug 16, 2016 at 11:40 AM, Kalle Svensson notifications@github.com
wrote:

> No, I'm doing that. As I said, I can train the net if I remove the
> num_epochs argument to tf.train.slice_input_producer and handle the
> epochs "manually" in the train loop.
> 
> —
